verses.text: 以色列行惡不忠耶和華說：「人若是休妻，妻子離開了他，又嫁了別人，前夫怎能與她復合呢？如果復合，那地不是大大玷污了嗎？你曾與許多情人行淫，還想歸向我。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Traditional term for divorcing a wife.
To reunite, implying former separation.
Reduplication for emphasis.
Often used in religious contexts for ritual impurity.
Specifically refers to sexual immorality.

verses.text: 「你向光禿的高岡舉目看看，哪裡沒有你的淫跡？你坐在路邊等候情人，像阿拉伯人在曠野埋伏一樣。你以淫亂和邪惡，把這地玷污了。

words.note: Often means 'look up'.
Reduplication softens tone or implies brief action.
Refers to evidence of sexual immorality.

verses.text: 所以甘霖停止，春雨不降；你還是一副妓女的面孔（「面孔」原文作「額」），不顧羞恥。

words.note: Refers to beneficial, refreshing rain.

words.definition: a set of, (classifier for facial expressions)
words.note: Classifier for facial expressions or pairs.

verses.text: 你剛剛不是還呼叫我：『我父啊！你是我年輕時的良伴；

words.note: Formal or respectful term for father; here, referring to God.
Often functions like 'when' in a phrase like '...time'.

verses.text: 耶和華怎會永遠懷怒，常存憤恨呢？』你雖然這樣說了，還是盡力去作惡。」

words.note: To keep anger or resentment.
Often indicates the direction or purpose of an action.

verses.text: 猶大與以色列行淫不忠約西亞王在位的日子，耶和華對我說：「背道的以色列所作的，她怎樣走上各高山，在每棵繁茂的樹下行淫，你看見了沒有？

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to spiritual unfaithfulness to God.
Lit. 'turn one's back on the way/truth'.
Indicates the object or result of a verb, similar to 'what' or 'that which'.
Refers to the practice of idolatry in groves under trees.
Used in an A-not-A question structure.

verses.text: 我以為她作了這些事以後，就必回轉過來，可是她沒有回轉。她詭詐的妹妹猶大也看見了。

words.note: In a spiritual context, implies turning back to God in repentance.
Indicates movement towards the speaker or a return to normal.
Implies cunning and disloyalty, particularly in a moral sense.

verses.text: 因背道的以色列犯了淫亂，我就給她休書，把她休了。我看見她詭詐的妹妹猶大還是不懼怕，照樣行淫。

words.note: Refers to a bill of divorce in biblical contexts.

words.definition: in the same way, as before

verses.text: 因以色列把自己的淫行視作等閒，去與石頭木頭行淫，就把這地玷污了。

words.note: Lit. 'equal to idle', meaning to treat something lightly or as insignificant.
In this context, often refers to idols made of wood.
Often used in a moral or religious sense of impurity.

verses.text: 雖然這樣，她詭詐的妹妹猶大還沒有全心歸向我，只是假意地歸我。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Implies turning towards a deity or a path, often in repentance.
Shortened form of 歸向 (guīxiàng) in this context.

verses.text: 悔改蒙恩耶和華對我說：「背道的以色列，比詭詐的猶大還顯得正義。

words.note: Lit. 'turn one's back on the way/path'

breakdown.m: to obtain; used after verb to indicate result

verses.text: 你去，把這些話向北方宣告，說：『背道的以色列啊，回轉吧！』這是耶和華的宣告。『我必不向你們變臉，因為我是慈愛的，我必不永遠懷怒。』這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Lit. 'turned away from the path'
Lit. 'change face', often implies showing anger or displeasure.

verses.text: 『只要你承認自己的罪孽，就是悖逆了耶和華你的 神，在每棵繁茂的樹下，濫愛外族人的神，沒有聽從我的話。』這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Refers to the one true God in this context.

words.definition: to promiscuously love, indulge in idolatry
words.note: Often refers to worshipping false gods or engaging in spiritual adultery.
Refers to pagan deities in this context.

verses.text: 『背道的人哪，回轉吧！』這是耶和華的宣告。『因為我才是你們的主。我要每城取一人，每族取二人，把你們帶到錫安。
「我必把合我心意的牧人賜給你們，他們要用知識和智慧牧養你們。
當那些日子，你們在這地繁衍增多的時候，人必不再提說耶和華的約櫃，不把它放在心上，不思念它，不覺得缺少，也不再製造。』這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: The Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH, transliterated.
Refers to the Ark of the Covenant in the Old Testament.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
Often used in the idiom '放在心上' (to take to heart).

verses.text: 『那時，人必稱耶路撒冷為耶和華的寶座，萬國要聚集到她那裡，因耶和華名的緣故來到耶路撒冷；他們必不再隨從自己頑梗的惡心行事。

words.note: Transliteration of 'Jerusalem'.
Refers to a royal or divine seat of authority.
Often used in biblical contexts to mean 'all peoples/nations'.
Distinct from '噁心' (ěxīn) meaning nausea.

verses.text: 在那些日子，猶大家必與以色列家同行，他們必從北方之地一同來到我賜給你們列祖為業的地方。』」

words.note: Refers to the tribe or kingdom of Judah.
Refers to the nation or northern kingdom of Israel.
Classical Chinese possessive particle, equivalent to '的'.
Often used in the Bible to refer to patriarchal ancestors.
In a biblical context, often refers to land or blessings as an inheritance.

verses.text: 「我說：『我待你，像待兒女一樣，賜給你佳美之地，就是列國中最美好的產業；我以為你會稱我為父，不再離去不跟從我了。

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive particle, equivalent to '的'.
Refers to a bequeathed property or blessing.

verses.text: 以色列家啊！妻子怎樣行奸詐對丈夫不忠，你也照樣以奸詐待我。』」這是耶和華的宣告。
在光禿的高岡聽到人聲，就是以色列人哭泣懇求的聲音；因為他們改轉了自己的道路，忘記了耶和華他們的 神。

words.note: Often used in repentance context.
Figuratively, one's conduct or chosen course.
The leading space is a traditional reverence marker.

verses.text: 「背道的人哪，回轉吧！我必醫治你們背道的病。」「看哪！我們來到你這裡，因為你是耶和華我們的 神！

words.note: Lit. 'turn one's back on the Way (of God)'.
Often implies turning back to God.
An archaic interjection, common in biblical texts.
The leading space is a traditional reverence marker.

verses.text: 小山和大山上的喧嚷，真是徒然的，以色列的救恩誠然在於耶和華我們的 神。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional reverence marker.

verses.text: 從我們幼年以來，我們列祖勞苦得來的，他們的牛羊，他們的兒女，都給那可恥的偶像吞掉了。
但願我們躺臥在羞恥中，讓慚愧遮蓋著我們！因為我們得罪了耶和華我們的 神，從我們幼年直到現在，我們和列祖都沒有聽從耶和華我們的 神的話。」

words.note: The leading space is a traditional reverence marker.
The leading space is a traditional reverence marker.
